intro: Hieracium bifidum subsp. ustedalicum, commonly known as the Ustalitic Hawkweed, is a flowering plant native to Central and Eastern Europe. It belongs to the family Asteraceae and is characterized by its yellow flowers and basal rosette of leaves. The plant typically grows in open, disturbed habitats such as roadsides and meadows. It has hairy stems and leaves that are often lobed or toothed. Due to its limited distribution, it is considered a rare and endangered species in many regions.
